text: John Couch Adams (5 June 1819 â€“ 21 January 1892), was an English mathematician and astronomer. Adams was born in Laneast, Cornwall and died in Cambridge. He was famous for co-discovering the planet Neptune. == Other websites == * Biography on the St Andrews database * Awarding of RAS gold medal: MNRAS 26 (1866) 157 * AJ 11 (1892) 112 * MNRAS 53 (1892) 184 * Obs 15 (1892) 173 Category:1819 births Category:1892 deaths Category:English astronomers Category:English mathematicians Category:People from Cornwall
title: John Couch Adams
